sub_title: Co-founder and CEO Attention Architects | Business Developer IXA Vrije Universiteit Amsterdam
summary:
Entrepreneur | Founder | Technology | Science | Innovation | Team | Lets make it happen! 

I am curious, eager to learn and have strong analytical skills. With my enthusiastic personality and a fairly competitive mentality I have the drive to perform at top level. As a true entrepreneur with a background in academia, my ambition is to transfer scientific knowledge and technology into business. I am always open to discuss collaborations or potential business opportunities.

In my work I bring together research and development, business development and sales. I have an eye for the value proposition and solving problems for clients. With excellent communication skills and due to my work experience at the university, start-ups and scale-ups, I learned to flourish in multidisciplinary and interactive environments. I prefer to work in, and lead, a team to put everyone in his and her strength, optimizing the interaction between the different building blocks of a business.  

Contact:

Tag me @bernobucker or reach out to me by email via berno@attentionarchitects.com | b.bucker@ixa.nl

profile_positions.description:
Business development | Start-up creation | Science | Impact

At IXA the joint knowledge and technology transfer office of the Amsterdam universities I work as a business development manager for the the Faculty of Behavioural and Movement Sciences (FGB) at the Vrije Universiteit Amsterdam. I work closely together with legal counsels, grant advisors, and world leading researchers. My goal is to create impact and assist in transferring scientific discoveries, research results and knowledge into ground breaking innovations and applications that improve lives, transform industries, and create substantial social and economic value.

Roles:
- Management team institute of Brain and Behavior Amsterdam (iBBA)
- Management team Demonstrator Lab Zuidas (VU)
- Member Impact Board FGB
profile_positions.title: Business Development Manager

profile_positions.description:
Eye Tracking & Biometric Research | Online experiments | Human factors | Way finding | Traffic Research | Neuromarketing

With both innovative and scientifically proven methods, such as eye-tracking, biometric measurements and online experiments, we tap into the conscious and non-conscious factors underling human behavior. We provide valuable insights and recommendations to optimize the communication toward your customers and the experiences they have with your products or service. Our expertise is in data driven research and quantitative evidence. We deliver research and consultancy according to the highest scientific standards. Domain expertise in (i) Visual communication (ii) Human factors (iii) Traffic and road design (iv) icons, signage and way finding. 

Grants & Awards: 
- 40.000eu NWO take-off 2018 (#16998)
- 40.000eu NWO take-off 2019 (#17761)
- 12.500eu Demonstrator Lab support
- Finals Amsterdam Science and Innovation Awards 2018
- ACE demo day 2018 most promising cohort startups
profile_positions.title: Co-founder & CEO

profile_positions.description:
Aesthetics | A.I. | Behavioral science | App | SaaS

Real Face Value is a company positioned at the intersection of aesthetics, artificial intelligence and behavioural science. We are convinced that optimal natural appearance is key to successful social and professional human interaction. Our company specializes in a method  that gives you feedback on the appearance of your face, from an aesthetic, social and professional viewpoint.
profile_positions.title: CSO & Product Owner

profile_positions.description:
Available for personal and group training | Kickboxing trainer @Sportcentrum VU | Ask for references

My goal as trainer is to get you excited for kickboxing as a sport and exercise. I work with women, men, young and old (12-65+) and focus on technique and execution. I train people from different levels, from first-timers and beginners to more advanced amateurs. My personal, friendly and energetic style make a kickboxing training with me a great success with strong personal progress for everyone.  

Experience with:
- Personal training
- Partner training
- Bag training
- Group training up to 40 persons
- Kids training from 12 years old and up
- Women, men, mixed trainings
- Kickboxing combined with: strength training, theory 
- Warming-up, cooling-down, stretching
- Combinations: technique, speed, strength
profile_positions.title: Kickboxing Instructor

profile_positions.description:
A.I. | Deep learning | Design Analytics 

AttentionCheck.com is a scientifically tested and AI-powered design analytics tool that knows where people will look at. Upload your design and discover what grabs the most attention objectively – without discussions or guesswork.
profile_positions.title: Founder & CEO

profile_positions.description:
Facial recognition | Software | Smart systems | Artificial Intelligence | Deep Learning

At 20Face we specialize in face recognition softwares and systems for various application domains. We are committed to provide the best solutions and services to help other businesses and companies in building more intelligent and smart products. With a complete awareness of the technical challenges in each application domain, we build robust and accurate software solutions and constantly research on ways to further improve them.
profile_positions.title: COO | Team Lead

profile_positions.description:
Science | Community manager | Networking | Project management | Policy 

My goal as the program manager of iBBA is to foster the exchange and development of advanced knowledge for (neuro-imaging) methods and research amongst Cognitive Psychology, Social and Organizational Neuroscience, Educational Neuroscience, Clinical Neuropsychology, and Human Movement Science. 

I support the institute in its function as a research incubator where researchers and students work together to push the limits of advanced methods of research. 

My duties include: 
Organizing: symposia, workshops, colloquia, meetings
Writing:  press releases, website content, newsletter, yearly reports
Support: funding applications, meetings MT, strategy, track expenses, external relations

http://ibba.institute/
profile_positions.title: Program Manager - institute Brain and Behavior Amsterdam (iBBA)

profile_positions.description:
Entrepreneurship | Incubator | Tech & Innovation | Business development

We will guide a start-up through incubation and acceleration and will have the focus and commitment, because we are part of your team. Not as a consultant or interim manager, but as a focussed entrepreneur. We know that even the best ideas need to be marketed well. We believe that the right sales and marketing approach will make the difference. That is why we provide you the opportunity to obtain a mix of commercial power, strategic planning and creative communication skills tuned to your needs.

profile_positions.title: Entrepeneur and Business Developer

profile_positions.description:
Besides my academic work on the role of reward and selection history in visual selective attention, I conducted project based work in the field of applied psychology and human factors.

Project-based work:

-Developing and investigating optimal waste recycling pictograms for Rijkswaterstaat (confidential report)

- Testing the comprehensiveness of specific road signs for Rijkswaterstaat and Mijksenaar Wayfinding Experts (confidential report)

- Using a mobile eye tracker to investigate how children and adults look at paintings of Van Gogh in the Van Gogh Museum Amsterdam (see publication)
profile_positions.title: Postdoctoral Researcher - Experimental and Applied Psychology

profile_positions.description:
Keywords: 
Visual perception, Attention, Reward, Learning, Eye tracking

Summary: 
The scientific articles I published during my PhD contribute to a body of literature, which shows that learning about rewards has a large impact on the allocation of attention and eye movements. Through Pavlovian and instrumental learning strategies we can assess which stimuli are predictive of or associated with reward, so that visual selective attention is biased towards them. The idea put forward in my thesis is that the activity level across the attentional priority map reflects the interplay between stimulus-driven and  goal-driven processing, which can be modulated by the learned significance or reward value that stimuli have acquired over time through experience.

Application:
My academic work is directly relevant and related to the field of marketing. 

Reference:
Bucker, B. (2017) Reward modulates visual selective attention (Doctoral research thesis). Vrije Universiteit Amsterdam, Amsterdam, The Netherlands. 

Link:
http://dare.ubvu.vu.nl/handle/1871/55285
profile_positions.title: PhD Student - Cognitve Psychology

company.name: Alumni Network Brain and Cognitive Sciences (ANBCS)

volunteer_experiences.description:
President:

In my role as president of the ANBCS, I serve as the chief volunteer and provide leadership to the board. This includes being the front-man on events and in the communication with other other organizations, strategic planning, chairing meetings, analyzing and evaluating performance of the network and its mission.

ANBCS:

The Alumni Network Brain and Cognitive Sciences is there to maintain and facilitate contact between alumni and between current students and alumni. We organize around 4 events per year. 
Please see our website and LinkedIn page for previous and upcoming events:

http://alumni.uva.nl/auv/kringen/brain-and-cognitive-sciences/brain-and-cognitive-sciences.html

http://linkedin.com/in/anbcs

In my role as a coach, my goal is to empower students of the Master Brain and Cognitive Sciences to develop the diverse skills and strategies necessary to successfully navigate throughout the master program and beyond.

I support students to become independent learners by encouraging them to take ownership of their own career and success. 

Individual coaching trajectories typically involve 6-8 sessions of 1h, including an intake and evaluation session.

company.name: Institute for Interdisciplinairy Studies (IIS) Universiteit van Amsterdam

volunteer_experiences.description: In my role as academic mentor I give academic advice, share resources, and focus on the students’ personal requests. This includes role-modeling study habits and teaching students, amongst others, about time and project management, reading, writing and presenting.
